decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly playing aggressive creatures and using direct damage spells to control the board and deal damage to the opponent. It also includes cards that provide additional value or protection to your creatures, and mana fixing to ensure you can cast your spells efficiently. With a mix of creatures, spells, and lands, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and consistent offensive strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game through various counterspells, removal spells, and disruptive cards. The deck utilizes powerful creatures like Nulldrifter and Phlage while also using the powerful artifact The One Ring to generate advantage and control the board. The inclusion of cards like Consign to Memory, Teferi, Time Raveler, and Dress Down allows the deck to effectively disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain dominance throughout the match. The deck aims to outvalue and outcontrol the opponent to secure victory.

The deck focuses on assembling a combo involving Basking Broodscale, Blade of the Bloodchief, and various support cards to generate a powerful board state. By using cards like Glaring Fleshraker and Walking Ballista, along with Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble for control, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of creatures while also disrupting their game plan. The deck utilizes Eldrazi Temple and Urza's Saga for mana acceleration and consistency, creating a fast and aggressive strategy that can quickly close out games.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan through counterspells, removal spells, and card advantage. By utilizing cards like Counterspell, Force of Negation, and Fatal Push, the deck aims to prevent threats from resolving and efficiently deal with opposing creatures. Additionally, the deck includes graveyard interaction with Unearth and Graveyard Trespasser to gain an advantage over graveyard-based strategies. The deck's win condition is to outvalue the opponent by controlling the game and potentially closing it out with large threats like Murktide Regent.

This deck focuses on using Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Underworld Breach to repeatedly cast artifacts from the graveyard, generating value and eventually winning the game with a combo involving Grinding Station and Thassa's Oracle. The deck also includes disruption spells like Spell Snare and removal like Unholy Heat to protect the combo and control the board. The land base is carefully constructed to support the deck's strategy and enable the player to find the necessary pieces with Urza's Saga and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student.

The deck focuses on utilizing ramp spells and mana accelerators to quickly cast powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. The control elements in the deck, such as Kozilek's Command and Malevolent Rumble, help to disrupt opponents and protect your board state. Karn, the Great Creator further enhances the control aspect by shutting down opponent's artifacts. The deck also includes Sowing Mycospawn to generate extra mana and card advantage. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with big threats while controlling the battlefield.

A fast-paced aggressive deck that focuses on flooding the board with creatures and overwhelming the opponent with damage. It utilizes powerful creatures like Amped Raptor and Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury, as well as direct damage spells like Galvanic Discharge and Lightning Bolt to finish off the opponent quickly. The deck also includes disruption elements like Thoughtseize and Static Prison to control the tempo of the game. Additionally, the inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion adds an extra level of consistency to the deck's game plan.

The deck focuses on utilizing artifacts to fuel the combo with Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Underworld Breach. The goal is to play and sacrifice artifacts like Mishra's Bauble and Mox Amber to generate mana and card advantage, while using Grinding Station to mill the opponent's deck. The engine is supported by Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and The One Ring to find key pieces. Malevolent Rumble provides disruption and removal. The deck aims to set up a loop where it can repeatedly cast spells from the graveyard, eventually winning with Thassa's Oracle or another win condition.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game by utilizing a combination of countermagic, removal spells, and graveyard manipulation. By using cards like Fatal Push, Counterspell, and Unearth, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also building its own threats with Murktide Regent and Graveyard Trespasser. This deck also includes efficient card draw with Consider and Thought Scour to help dig for key pieces. The mana base is focused on fetching the appropriate colors of mana quickly to support the deck's diverse spell requirements.

This deck focuses on assembling a powerful combo without using any lands. By utilizing cards like Fallaji Archaeologist, Hydroelectric Specimen, and Thundertrap Trainer, the deck aims to create a win condition with Goblin Charbelcher. The deck also includes various counterspells like Disrupting Shoal and Pact of Negation to protect the combo pieces. Additionally, cards like Lotus Bloom and Whir of Invention help ramp up mana and search for key pieces. The key strategy is to quickly assemble the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan while going off for the win.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of powerful Eldrazi creatures and the UrzaTron lands. By ramping up mana quickly with Expedition Map and Urza lands, the deck can quickly play out threats like Thought-Knot Seer and World Breaker. The deck also utilizes powerful artifacts like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin's Labyrinth to disrupt opponents' strategies. The goal is to overwhelm opponents with big creatures and disruptive spells while maintaining control of the game through mana ramp and resource denial.

This deck focuses on utilizing Amulet of Vigor and Primeval Titan to quickly generate a large amount of mana and search for powerful lands such as Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and The Mycosynth Gardens. The deck aims to create a powerful board state with multiple lands in play to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and destructive spells. Using cards like The One Ring and Malevolent Rumble to control the board and protect the combo, this deck aims to assemble its pieces quickly and efficiently to achieve victory.

This deck focuses on utilizing the Amulet of Vigor to enable explosive plays with Primeval Titan, allowing for quick ramping and powerful combo finishes. The key strategy involves generating mana quickly through land drops and untapping with Amulet of Vigor, allowing for powerful toolbox plays with Urza's Saga, Boseiju, Who Endures, and other utility lands. The deck aims to set up a powerful board state with multiple land drops per turn and utilize Primeval Titan's powerful ETB ability to search for key lands like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle or Vesuva to close out the game.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures and then using spells like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to bring them back onto the battlefield for a surprise attack. A combination of instant-speed reanimation and disruption spells allows for a fast-paced and unpredictable playstyle, keeping opponents on their toes. Key cards like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Emperor of Bones provide strong reanimation targets while Solitude and Force of Negation offer protection and control. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with unexpected combos and efficient card advantage.

The deck focuses on cheating powerful creatures from the graveyard onto the battlefield by cycling low-cost creatures and casting Living End to bring them back all at once. The key strategy is to control the game with counterspells and disruptive creatures until the combo can be assembled, overwhelming the opponent with a board full of large creatures. The deck also includes ways to manipulate the top of the library to ensure getting the cards needed for the combo. The goal is to win the game quickly with a burst of powerful creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by countering and removing threats while using The One Ring to gain advantage and control the board. By utilizing a mix of counterspells, removal spells, and powerful enchantments, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and protect its own game plan. The variety of lands and spells help to ensure consistency and efficiency in executing the control strategy, ultimately leading to victory through careful planning and resource management.

This deck focuses on milling your opponent's deck as quickly as possible using cards like Ruin Crab, Hedron Crab, and Archive Trap. The deck also includes ways to disrupt your opponent's game plan with cards like Surgical Extraction and Drown in the Loch, while also drawing cards and keeping your hand full with Visions of Beyond. The goal is to mill your opponent out of cards before they can assemble their win condition, utilizing various lands to help accomplish this strategy efficiently in a Modern 1 vs 1 format.

The main concept is to utilize low-cost spells and creatures to apply pressure on the opponent quickly. The deck aims to consistently deal damage early on with cards like Monastery Swiftspear, Slickshot Show-Off, and Dragon's Rage Channeler, while also having access to burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lava Dart to finish off the opponent. The inclusion of Underworld Breach allows for the deck to potentially reuse spells from the graveyard, providing additional reach and closing out games efficiently. The deck also includes Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion, enabling additional consistency and versatility.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal, and powerful creatures. It utilizes Elementals such as Risen Reef and Omnath, Locus of Creation to generate value and pressure opponents. The inclusion of cards like Supreme Verdict and Solitude ensures the deck can handle a variety of threats. The mana base is carefully curated to support the diverse color requirements of the deck. Overall, the strategy revolves around disrupting the opponent's game plan while establishing a strong board presence with powerful Elemental creatures.

This deck revolves around equipping cheap artifacts like Colossus Hammer and Kaldra Compleat to creatures like Esper Sentinel and Gingerbrute to create a powerful attacking force. It utilizes Stoneforge Mystic to search for the necessary equipment pieces and Puresteel Paladin to draw cards and reduce equip costs. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Spell Pierce and Mana Tithe to protect its combo pieces. Urza's Saga is used to tutor for key artifacts, while synergizing with the deck's strategy. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with a massive, equipped creature.

The deck focuses on assembling the Heliod, Sun-Crowned and Spike Feeder combo to gain infinite life and create an infinitely large creature. This combo is supported by cards like Auriok Champion to protect the combo pieces, Guide of Souls for tutoring, and Collected Company for card advantage. Teferi, Time Raveler is used to disrupt opponents' strategies and Boseiju, Who Endures can protect key spells from counterspells. The deck aims to control the game until it can assemble the combo and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful synergies.

The key concept of this Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan by utilizing removal spells such as Fatal Push and Fell the Profane, while also utilizing discard spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to strip the opponent's hand of key cards. The deck focuses on controlling the board through cards like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Orcish Bowmasters, while also generating value through cards like Boggart Trawler and Necrodominance. The win condition revolves around slowly draining the opponent's life total with Soul Spike and overwhelming them with powerful threats like The One Ring.

The main objective of this deck is to control the game through removal spells and countermagic while setting up for a powerful win condition with Scapeshift. The deck aims to ramp up to a critical mass of lands, then cast Scapeshift to search for multiple Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Mountains to deal lethal damage to the opponent in one big combo turn. The Leyline cards provide protection and disruption, while Wrenn and Six helps with recurring lands and card advantage. Dryad of the Ilysian Grove allows for additional land drops and fixing, while Prismatic Ending offers versatile removal options.

This deck focuses on utilizing Shifting Woodland to manipulate the game state and set up powerful combos. By tutoring for key pieces like Omniscience and Malevolent Rumble, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a mix of control and aggression. Karn, the Great Creator acts as a versatile toolbox, while Arcane Proxy and Glimpse of Tomorrow provide additional utility and card advantage. The inclusion of Archon of Cruelty and Bloodbraid Marauder adds a threatening presence to the board, making it difficult for the opponent to stabilize. Overall, this deck is designed to outmaneuver opponents and establish a dominant board presence.
